image.altText: SUV with bullet holes

props.synopsis: Police say tactical officers foiled an alleged planned hit near a day care centre in Revesby in Sydney's south-west on Tuesday afternoon.

title.children: Police foil alleged 'kill team' hit near Sydney day care centre

image.altText: A wide shot of mass destruction, rubble and a large grey smoke plume over a horizon.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump insists the United States will "do everything possible" to prevent Israel restarting the war in Gaza, in the event Hamas agrees to a peace deal.

title.children: US to 'do everything possible' to prevent war if Hamas agrees to peace deal

image.altText: A sailing boat with "Free Gaza" written on the side in red paint.

props.synopsis: Seven Australian activists arrested while trying to break Israel's naval blockade of Gaza have been deported to Jordan, the ABC understands.

title.children: Australians released from Israeli detention after alleged beatings

image.altText: Andreas Slavkos at his graduation.

props.synopsis: Students have been left with HECS debts and careers that are "non-existent" after completing degrees that were not accredited. Class actions have been launched against two Australian universities.

title.children: Careers in limbo after graduates discover university courses were never accredited

image.altText: An illustration of Google search on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: One year on from the rollout of Google AI Overviews in Australia, exclusive data shows steep year-on-year declines in readership for the top news websites as smaller publishers warn of lay-offs.

title.children: Fears of online journalism Armageddon as Google changes the game

image.altText: A white woman with long brown hair and glasses standing in a kitchen

props.synopsis: A year after a controversial NDIS change, advocates are growing increasingly concerned that "counterintuitive" and "nonsensical" funding decisions are reducing participant independence.

title.children: 'I was so cross': NDIS participants blast 'nonsensical' spending rules

image.altText: A woman in a dark hijab smiles as she holds a toddler in her arms on a beach.

props.synopsis: Children in Gaza are experiencing grief, loss, displacement, and starvation. For some, this is all they know or remember.

title.children: Born as the first bombs fell, 2yo Mohammad has known nothing but war

image.altText: John Noh speaks into a microphone at a wood desk.

props.synopsis: The AUKUS submarine pact may need "commonsense" action from both Australia and the US to make it more "sustainable", according to Donald Trump's nominee to oversee US defence strategy in the Indo-Pacific.

title.children: Trump's Pentagon nominee flags possible 'commonsense' AUKUS changes

image.altText: A woman in police uniform at a press conference.

props.synopsis: In a wide-ranging interview as she begins as AFP commissioner, Krissy Barrett announces a new sub-terror strike force, and flags that newly written hate crime laws may need to be strengthened further.

title.children: New AFP boss warns hate crime laws may need to be strengthened further

image.altText: Flames at the blast furnace at Whyalla's steelworks.

props.synopsis: A future made in Australia? Not if gas prices keep rising, major manufacturers warn as they call for urgent action to secure affordable supply.

title.children: Industry warns 'no gas, no future' amid high prices and falling demand

image.altText: Anika Wells leafs through papers in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: The adequacy of Australia's emergency call network will be stress tested with a surprise drill ahead of bushfire season, as the opposition ramps up its assault over the communication minister's handling of last month's fatal triple-0 outage.

title.children: Telcos face surprise 'stress test' within weeks as Optus fallout continues

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: Officials from two departments will be questioned today about the government's handling of the Optus triple-0 outages. Follow live.

title.children: Officials to be grilled over Optus outages in Senate estimates

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Coalition targets spending, vows to take cuts to next election
'Urgent' call for disaster roaming ahead of bushfire season
Clash over return of women and children stranded in Syria

image.altText: A side image of Trump on stage and a background that reads 'pursuing peace'

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has made no secret that he wants to win this year's Nobel Peace Prize. Here's why experts say it's unlikely he'll win the prestigious award.

title.children: Will Trump win the Nobel Peace Prize?

image.altText: Mobile phone betting apps generic

props.synopsis: The NT government is standing by its de-facto regulation of Australia’s $50 billion online gambling industry, despite allegations that it is too closely linked to the sector.

title.children: NT government reviewing conflict allegations against gambling regulator

image.altText: A concept image of the proposed Hobart stadium at Macquarie Poi nt.

props.synopsis: The state government response to last month's scathing report from the planning commission says that while "change can be challenging", the "dream of a Tasmanian team representing our state in the AFL and AFLW is now within reach — we cannot turn back".

title.children: 'Cannot turn back': Tasmanian government responds to scathing Hobart stadium report

image.altText: a man in a yellow jumper looking at rubble

props.synopsis: Residents who lost their homes in a blaze that ripped through WA's southern wheatbelt in January may have to wait more than two years to seek compensation.

title.children: Widower living in bus as he waits for answers on fire that destroyed home

image.altText: A saltwater crocodile leaning up against a muddy brown bank, with black zip-ties around it's mouth.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a saltwater crocodile with its mouth bound shut by zip ties in a Darwin river has sparked outrage, with animal rights advocates calling for stronger wildlife protections.

title.children: Disturbing discovery of zip-tied crocodile triggers investigation

image.altText: A disability facility in suburban Adelaide.

props.synopsis: A South Australian government aged care home, which looks after 23 people with dementia or complex disabilities, inappropriately used lap belts and other mechanical restraints to stop falls and control residents' behaviour, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: 'It's a human rights tragedy': Aged care facility inappropriately restrained residents

image.altText: Close-up of a black stingless bee sitting on a white flower petal of an orchid.

props.synopsis: Researchers behind a new study examining thousands of flower specimens collected over the past century say temperature increases could be behind a pollination decline in native orchids.

title.children: One hundred years of Australian flower data reveals pollination drop

image.altText: Woman wearing a camera strapped to her

props.synopsis: A Queensland council is ramping up efforts to protect staff following an alarming rise in verbal and physical abuse.

title.children: Council resorts to security guards, body cameras amid rising violence

image.altText: Marnus Labuschagne walks out to bat.

props.synopsis: The Sheffield Shield is underway, with all eyes on the contenders for Australia's problematic opener spot. Here are five quick hits from the opening round of the season.

title.children: Five quick hits: Marnus scores big, other Test hopefuls flounder in Shield openers

image.altText: A woman sits in front of a computer open to a screen showing purple and green colours

props.synopsis: Data experts say it is hard to know what the implications are for 3,000 flood victims who have had personal information uploaded to the AI platform by a government contractor.

title.children: Can private information uploaded to ChatGPT be found by other users?

image.altText: Emmanuel Macron looking slightly to the left in a crowd.

props.synopsis: Emmanuel Macron's first prime minister urges the cornered French head of state to resign in a shock call that compounded an escalating political crisis.

title.children: Macron urged by his first PM to resign in escalating French crisis

image.altText: A render of a proposed 17-storey community and affordable housing tower in Greensborough,

props.synopsis: A Victorian housing charity awarded more than $200 million in taxpayer funds for a proposed 17-storey tower is controlled by a for-profit investment firm, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Charity run by investment firm linked to 17-storey suburban tower

image.altText: LeBron James looks to his side

props.synopsis: LeBron James's "retirement teaser" — which blew out ticket prices for the LA Lakers' final home game of the regular season — ends up being an advertisement for cognac.

title.children: LeBron's 'decision' just an ad as Lakers ticket prices soar by 700pc

image.altText: Silhouette of woman and hands

props.synopsis: In a study involving about 200,000 people diagnosed with depression, scientists have identified almost twice as many genetic red flags in the DNA of females compared with males.

title.children: Research shows females carry a much higher genetic risk for major depression

image.altText: Shaun de Bruyn stands in a grassed area wearing a white shirt and navy suit

props.synopsis: Tourism, seafood industry and community representatives are calling for greater funding, education and travel incentives ahead of the release of the South Australian government's upcoming Summer Plan.

title.children: Tourism operators facing 'dire straits' without more algal bloom relief

image.altText: A sign showing the Nobel Prize in Physics medal

props.synopsis: Three scientists have won the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics for "the discovery of macroscopic quantum mechanical tunnelling and energy quantisation in an electric circuit".

title.children: Scientists win Nobel Prize in Physics for discoveries in quantum mechanics

image.altText: main pic

props.synopsis: There has been a surge in downloads of the SharkSmart app following the fatal attack of a Northern Beaches surfer — in a sign the incident has left some nervous to get back into the water.

title.children: Surge in shark-tracking app downloads following fatal Sydney attack

image.altText: A man in camo fatigues stands in front of a US flag.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump is ramping up efforts to deploy the National Guard in more cities across the country to combat what he claims is a "war from within". Here's a quick rundown on where Mr Trump has stationed troops — and which cities might be next.

title.children: Trump is deploying more troops on home soil — here's where things stand

image.altText: A crowd of people in hi-vis stand around a tarp near a helicopter.

props.synopsis: Iris Stalzer, a Social Democrat who was elected mayor of Herdecke in the Ruhr region a week ago, is reportedly suffered life-threatening injuries.

title.children: German mayor stabbed outside home, Chancellor Merz condemns 'abhorrent act'

image.altText: Jaffles on a tray covered in sugar, with milk and coffee.

props.synopsis: An oatmeal-filled jaffle made by a Melbourne food stylist and flavoured with Bundaberg Rum and bananas wins over judges in Scotland.

title.children: Australian wins with a jaffle at World Porridge Making Championship

image.altText: Hobart Lord Mayor Sue Hickey in ceremonial chains and robe.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian councillors could be removed from their democratically elected positions under changes proposed to local government legislation.

title.children: Tasmanian government moves to crack down on unruly councillors

image.altText: Ibrahim Helmy sits in chair in front of microphone

props.synopsis: Ibrahim Helmy, who vanished before an inquiry into transport kickbacks, watched the first day of the Independent Commission Against Corruption public hearings via live stream.

title.children: ICAC witness found in cupboard allegedly received $11.5m in payments

image.altText: Four women, all in different outfits, in an outdoor restaurant seating area in front of a red brick building.

props.synopsis: Parents of children with disability can miss out on social support, but a Victorian physiotherapist hopes to change that.

title.children: Social group helping parents of kids with disability find connection
